Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/sqr.c

23#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
24#include "mpfr-impl.h"
25
26#if !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI) && (GMP_NUMB_BITS == 32 || GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64)
27
28/* Special code for prec(a) < GMP_NUMB_BITS and prec(b) <= GMP_NUMB_BITS.
29 Note: this function was copied from mpfr_mul_1 in file mul.c, thus any change
30 here should be done also in mpfr_mul_1. */
31static int
32mpfr_sqr_1 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode, mpfr_prec_t p)
33{
34 mp_limb_t a0;
35 mpfr_limb_ptr ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
36 mp_limb_t b0 = MPFR_MANT(b)[0];
37 mpfr_exp_t ax;
38 mpfr_prec_t sh = GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
39 mp_limb_t rb, sb, mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
40
41 /* When prec(b) <= GMP_NUMB_BITS / 2, we could replace umul_ppmm
42 by a limb multiplication as follows, but we assume umul_ppmm is as fast
43 as a limb multiplication on modern processors:
44 a0 = (b0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS / 2)) * (b0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS / 2));
45 sb = 0;
46 */
47 ax = MPFR_GET_EXP(b) * 2;
48 umul_ppmm (a0, sb, b0, b0);
49 if (a0 < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
50 {
51 ax --;
52 a0 = (a0 << 1) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
53 sb <<= 1;
54 }
55 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
56 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
57 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
58
59 MPFR_SIGN(a) = MPFR_SIGN_POS;
60
61 /* rounding */
62 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax > __gmpfr_emax))
63 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
64
65 /* Warning: underflow should be checked *after* rounding, thus when rounding
66 away and when a > 0.111...111*2^(emin-1), or when rounding to nearest and
67 a >= 0.111...111[1]*2^(emin-1), there is no underflow. */
68 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax < __gmpfr_emin))
69 {
70 /* Note: for emin=2*k+1, a >= 0.111...111*2^(emin-1) is not possible,
71 i.e., a >= (1 - 2^(-p))*2^(2k), since we need a = b^2 with EXP(b)=k,
72 and the largest such b is (1 - 2^(-p))*2^k satisfies
73 b^2 < (1 - 2^(-p))*2^(2k).
74 For emin=2*k, it is only possible for some values of p: it is not
75 possible for p=53, because the largest significand is 6369051672525772
76 but its square has only 52 leading ones. For p=24 it is possible,
77 with b = 11863283, whose square has 24 leading ones. */
78 if ((ax == __gmpfr_emin - 1) && (ap[0] == ~mask) &&
79 ((rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && rb) ||
80 (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDA(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG (a)) && (rb | sb))))
81 goto rounding; /* no underflow */
82 /* For RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |a| <= 2^(emin-2)
83 we have to change to RNDZ. This corresponds to:
84 (a) either ax < emin - 1
85 (b) or ax = emin - 1 and ap[0] = 1000....000 and rb = sb = 0 */
86 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
87 (ax < __gmpfr_emin - 1 || (ap[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && (rb | sb) == 0)))
88 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
89 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
90 }
91
92 rounding:
93 MPFR_EXP (a) = ax; /* Don't use MPFR_SET_EXP since ax might be < __gmpfr_emin
94 in the cases "goto rounding" above. */
95 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
96 {
97 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax >= __gmpfr_emin);
98 MPFR_RET (0);
99 }
100 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
101 {
102 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0))
103 goto truncate;
104 else
105 goto add_one_ulp;
106 }
107 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
108 {
109 truncate:
110 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax >= __gmpfr_emin);
111 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN_POS);
112 }
113 else /* round away from zero */
114 {
115 add_one_ulp:
116 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
117 if (ap[0] == 0)
118 {
119 ap[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
120 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax + 1 > __gmpfr_emax))
121 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
122 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
123 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax + 1 >= __gmpfr_emin);
124 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, ax + 1);
125 }
126 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN_POS);
127 }
128}
129
130/* special code for PREC(a) = GMP_NUMB_BITS */
131static int
132mpfr_sqr_1n (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
133{
134 mp_limb_t a0;
135 mpfr_limb_ptr ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
136 mp_limb_t b0 = MPFR_MANT(b)[0];
137 mpfr_exp_t ax;
138 mp_limb_t rb, sb;
139
140 ax = MPFR_GET_EXP(b) * 2;
141 umul_ppmm (a0, sb, b0, b0);
142 if (a0 < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
143 {
144 ax --;
145 a0 = (a0 << 1) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
146 sb <<= 1;
147 }
148 rb = sb & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
149 sb = sb & ~MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
150 ap[0] = a0;
151
152 MPFR_SIGN(a) = MPFR_SIGN_POS;
153
154 /* rounding */
155 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax > __gmpfr_emax))
156 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
157
158 /* Warning: underflow should be checked *after* rounding, thus when rounding
159 away and when a > 0.111...111*2^(emin-1), or when rounding to nearest and
160 a >= 0.111...111[1]*2^(emin-1), there is no underflow. */
161 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax < __gmpfr_emin))
162 {
163 /* As seen in mpfr_mul_1, we cannot have a0 = 111...111 here if there
164 was not exponent decrease (ax--) above.
165 In the case of an exponent decrease, it is not possible for
166 GMP_NUMB_BITS=32 since the largest b0 such that b0^2 < 2^(2*32-1)
167 is b0=3037000499, but its square has only 30 leading ones.
168 For GMP_NUMB_BITS=64 it is possible: the largest b0 is
169 13043817825332782212, and its square has 64 leading ones. */
170 if ((ax == __gmpfr_emin - 1) && (ap[0] == ~MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT) &&
171 ((rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && rb) ||
172 (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDA(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG (a)) && (rb | sb))))
173 goto rounding; /* no underflow */
174 /* For RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |a| <= 2^(emin-2)
175 we have to change to RNDZ. This corresponds to:
176 (a) either ax < emin - 1
177 (b) or ax = emin - 1 and ap[0] = 1000....000 and rb = sb = 0 */
178 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
179 (ax < __gmpfr_emin - 1 || (ap[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && (rb | sb) == 0)))
180 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
181 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
182 }
183
184 rounding:
185 MPFR_EXP (a) = ax; /* Don't use MPFR_SET_EXP since ax might be < __gmpfr_emin
186 in the cases "goto rounding" above. */
187 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
188 {
189 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax >= __gmpfr_emin);
190 MPFR_RET (0);
191 }
192 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
193 {
194 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & MPFR_LIMB_ONE) == 0))
195 goto truncate;
196 else
197 goto add_one_ulp;
198 }
199 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
200 {
201 truncate:
202 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax >= __gmpfr_emin);
203 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN_POS);
204 }
205 else /* round away from zero */
206 {
207 add_one_ulp:
208 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
209 if (ap[0] == 0)
210 {
211 ap[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
212 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax + 1 > __gmpfr_emax))
213 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
214 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
215 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax + 1 >= __gmpfr_emin);
216 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, ax + 1);
217 }
218 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN_POS);
219 }
220}
221
222/* Special code for GMP_NUMB_BITS < prec(a) < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS and
223 GMP_NUMB_BITS < prec(b) <= 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS.
224 Note: this function was copied and optimized from mpfr_mul_2 in file mul.c,
225 thus any change here should be done also in mpfr_mul_2, if applicable. */
226static int
227mpfr_sqr_2 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode, mpfr_prec_t p)
228{
229 mp_limb_t h, l, u, v;
230 mpfr_limb_ptr ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
231 mpfr_exp_t ax = 2 * MPFR_GET_EXP(b);
232 mpfr_prec_t sh = 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
233 mp_limb_t rb, sb, sb2, mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
234 mp_limb_t *bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
235
236 /* we store the 4-limb product in h=ap[1], l=ap[0], sb=ap[-1], sb2=ap[-2] */
237 umul_ppmm (h, l, bp[1], bp[1]);
238 umul_ppmm (u, v, bp[1], bp[0]);
239 l += u << 1;
240 h += (l < (u << 1)) + (u >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
241
242 /* now the full square is {h, l, 2*v + high(b0*c0), low(b0*c0)},
243 where the lower part contributes to less than 3 ulps to {h, l} */
244
245 /* If h has its most significant bit set and the low sh-1 bits of l are not
246 000...000 nor 111...111 nor 111...110, then we can round correctly;
247 if h has zero as most significant bit, we have to shift left h and l,
248 thus if the low sh-2 bits are not 000...000 nor 111...111 nor 111...110,
249 then we can round correctly. To avoid an extra test we consider the latter
250 case (if we can round, we can also round in the former case).
251 For sh <= 3, we have mask <= 7, thus (mask>>2) <= 1, and the approximation
252 cannot be enough. */
253 if (MPFR_LIKELY(((l + 2) & (mask >> 2)) > 2))
254 sb = sb2 = 1; /* result cannot be exact in that case */
255 else
256 {
257 mp_limb_t carry1, carry2;
258
259 umul_ppmm (sb, sb2, bp[0], bp[0]);
260 /* the full product is {h, l, sb + v + w, sb2} */
261 ADD_LIMB (sb, v, carry1);
262 ADD_LIMB (l, carry1, carry2);
263 h += carry2;
264 ADD_LIMB (sb, v, carry1);
265 ADD_LIMB (l, carry1, carry2);
266 h += carry2;
267 }
268 if (h < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
269 {
270 ax --;
271 h = (h << 1) | (l >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
272 l = (l << 1) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
273 sb <<= 1;
274 /* no need to shift sb2 since we only want to know if it is zero or not */
275 }
276 ap[1] = h;
277 rb = l & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
278 sb |= ((l & mask) ^ rb) | sb2;
279 ap[0] = l & ~mask;
280
281 MPFR_SIGN(a) = MPFR_SIGN_POS;
282
283 /* rounding */
284 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax > __gmpfr_emax))
285 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
286
287 /* Warning: underflow should be checked *after* rounding, thus when rounding
288 away and when a > 0.111...111*2^(emin-1), or when rounding to nearest and
289 a >= 0.111...111[1]*2^(emin-1), there is no underflow. */
290 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax < __gmpfr_emin))
291 {
292 /* Note: like for mpfr_sqr_2, the case
293 0.111...111*2^(emin-1) < a < 2^(emin-1) is not possible when emin is
294 odd, since (modulo a shift) this would imply 1-2^(-p) < a = b^2 < 1,
295 and this is not possible with 1-2^(-p) <= b < 1.
296 For emin even, it is possible for some values of p, for example for
297 p=69 with b=417402170410649030795*2^k. */
298 if ((ax == __gmpfr_emin - 1) &&
299 (ap[1] == MPFR_LIMB_MAX) &&
300 (ap[0] == ~mask) &&
301 ((rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && rb) ||
302 (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDA(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG (a)) && (rb | sb))))
303 goto rounding; /* no underflow */
304 /* for RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |a| <= 2^(emin-2)
305 we have to change to RNDZ */
306 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
307 (ax < __gmpfr_emin - 1 ||
308 (ap[1] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && ap[0] == 0 && (rb | sb) == 0)))
309 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
310 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
311 }
312
313 rounding:
314 MPFR_EXP (a) = ax; /* Don't use MPFR_SET_EXP since ax might be < __gmpfr_emin
315 in the cases "goto rounding" above. */
316 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
317 {
318 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax >= __gmpfr_emin);
319 MPFR_RET (0);
320 }
321 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
322 {
323 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0))
324 goto truncate;
325 else
326 goto add_one_ulp;
327 }
328 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
329 {
330 truncate:
331 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax >= __gmpfr_emin);
332 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN_POS);
333 }
334 else /* round away from zero */
335 {
336 add_one_ulp:
337 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
338 ap[1] += (ap[0] == 0);
339 if (ap[1] == 0)
340 {
341 ap[1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
342 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax + 1 > __gmpfr_emax))
343 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
344 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
345 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax + 1 >= __gmpfr_emin);
346 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, ax + 1);
347 }
348 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN_POS);
349 }
350}
351
352/* Special code for 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS < prec(a) < 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS and
353 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS < prec(b) <= 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS. */
354static int
355mpfr_sqr_3 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode, mpfr_prec_t p)
356{
357 mp_limb_t a0, a1, a2, h, l;
358 mpfr_limb_ptr ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
359 mpfr_exp_t ax = 2 * MPFR_GET_EXP(b);
360 mpfr_prec_t sh = 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
361 mp_limb_t rb, sb, sb2, mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
362 mp_limb_t *bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
363
364 /* we store the upper 3-limb product in a2, a1, a0:
365 b2^2, 2*b2*b1, 2*b2*b0+b1^2 */
366
367 /* first compute b2*b1 and b2*b0, which will be shifted by 1 */
368 umul_ppmm (a1, a0, bp[2], bp[1]);
369 umul_ppmm (h, l, bp[2], bp[0]);
370 a0 += h;
371 a1 += (a0 < h);
372 /* now a1, a0 contains b2*b1 + floor(b2*b0/B): there can be no overflow
373 since b2*b1*B + b2*b0 <= b2*(b1*B+b0) <= b2*(B^2-1) < B^3 */
374
375 /* multiply a2, a1, a0 by 2 */
376 a2 = a1 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1);
377 a1 = (a1 << 1) | (a0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
378 a0 = (a0 << 1);
379
380 /* add b2^2 */
381 umul_ppmm (h, l, bp[2], bp[2]);
382 a1 += l;
383 a2 += h + (a1 < l);
384
385 /* add b1^2 */
386 umul_ppmm (h, l, bp[1], bp[1]);
387 a0 += h;
388 a1 += (a0 < h);
389 a2 += (a1 == 0 && a0 < h);
390
391 /* Now the approximate product {a2, a1, a0} has an error of less than
392 5 ulps (3 ulps for the ignored low limbs of 2*b2*b0+b1^2,
393 plus 2 ulps for the ignored 2*b1*b0 (plus b0^2).
394 Since we might shift by 1 bit, we make sure the low sh-2 bits of a0
395 are not 0, -1, -2, -3 or -4. */
396
397 if (MPFR_LIKELY(((a0 + 4) & (mask >> 2)) > 4))
398 sb = sb2 = 1; /* result cannot be exact in that case */
399 else
400 {
401 mp_limb_t p[6];
402 mpn_sqr (p, bp, 3);
403 a2 = p[5];
404 a1 = p[4];
405 a0 = p[3];
406 sb = p[2];
407 sb2 = p[1] | p[0];
408 }
409 if (a2 < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
410 {
411 ax --;
412 a2 = (a2 << 1) | (a1 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
413 a1 = (a1 << 1) | (a0 >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
414 a0 = (a0 << 1) | (sb >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
415 sb <<= 1;
416 /* no need to shift sb2: we only need to know if it is zero or not */
417 }
418 ap[2] = a2;
419 ap[1] = a1;
420 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
421 sb |= ((a0 & mask) ^ rb) | sb2;
422 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
423
424 MPFR_SIGN(a) = MPFR_SIGN_POS;
425
426 /* rounding */
427 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax > __gmpfr_emax))
428 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
429
430 /* Warning: underflow should be checked *after* rounding, thus when rounding
431 away and when a > 0.111...111*2^(emin-1), or when rounding to nearest and
432 a >= 0.111...111[1]*2^(emin-1), there is no underflow. */
433 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax < __gmpfr_emin))
434 {
435 if ((ax == __gmpfr_emin - 1) &&
436 (ap[2] == MPFR_LIMB_MAX) &&
437 (ap[1] == MPFR_LIMB_MAX) &&
438 (ap[0] == ~mask) &&
439 ((rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && rb) ||
440 (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDA(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG (a)) && (rb | sb))))
441 goto rounding; /* no underflow */
442 /* for RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |a| <= 2^(emin-2)
443 we have to change to RNDZ */
444 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
445 (ax < __gmpfr_emin - 1 ||
446 (ap[2] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && ap[1] == 0 && ap[0] == 0
447 && (rb | sb) == 0)))
448 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
449 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
450 }
451
452 rounding:
453 MPFR_EXP (a) = ax; /* Don't use MPFR_SET_EXP since ax might be < __gmpfr_emin
454 in the cases "goto rounding" above. */
455 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
456 {
457 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax >= __gmpfr_emin);
458 MPFR_RET (0);
459 }
460 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
461 {
462 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0))
463 goto truncate;
464 else
465 goto add_one_ulp;
466 }
467 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
468 {
469 truncate:
470 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax >= __gmpfr_emin);
471 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN_POS);
472 }
473 else /* round away from zero */
474 {
475 add_one_ulp:
476 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
477 ap[1] += (ap[0] == 0);
478 ap[2] += (ap[1] == 0) && (ap[0] == 0);
479 if (ap[2] == 0)
480 {
481 ap[2] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
482 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ax + 1 > __gmpfr_emax))
483 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
484 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
485 MPFR_ASSERTD(ax + 1 >= __gmpfr_emin);
486 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, ax + 1);
487 }
488 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN_POS);
489 }
490}
491
492#endif /* !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI) && ... */
493
494/* Note: mpfr_sqr will call mpfr_mul if bn > MPFR_SQR_THRESHOLD,
495 in order to use Mulders' mulhigh, which is handled only here
496 to avoid partial code duplication. There is some overhead due
497 to the additional tests, but slowdown should not be noticeable
498 as this code is not executed in very small precisions. */
499
500int
501mpfr_sqr (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
502{
503 int cc, inexact;
504 mpfr_exp_t ax;
505 mp_limb_t *tmp;
506 mp_limb_t b1;
507 mpfr_prec_t aq, bq;
508 mp_size_t bn, tn;
509 MPFR_TMP_DECL(marker);
510
511 MPFR_LOG_FUNC
512 (("x[%Pu]=%.*Rg rnd=%d", mpfr_get_prec (b), mpfr_log_prec, b, rnd_mode),
513 ("y[%Pu]=%.*Rg inexact=%d",
514 mpfr_get_prec (a), mpfr_log_prec, a, inexact));
515
516 /* deal with special cases */
517 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(MPFR_IS_SINGULAR(b)))
518 {
519 if (MPFR_IS_NAN(b))
520 {
521 MPFR_SET_NAN(a);
522 MPFR_RET_NAN;
523 }
524 MPFR_SET_POS (a);
525 if (MPFR_IS_INF(b))
526 MPFR_SET_INF(a);
527 else
528 ( MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_IS_ZERO(b)), MPFR_SET_ZERO(a) );
529 MPFR_RET(0);
530 }
531 aq = MPFR_GET_PREC(a);
532 bq = MPFR_GET_PREC(b);
533
534#if !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI) && (GMP_NUMB_BITS == 32 || GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64)
535 if (aq < GMP_NUMB_BITS && bq <= GMP_NUMB_BITS)
536 return mpfr_sqr_1 (a, b, rnd_mode, aq);
537
538 if (GMP_NUMB_BITS < aq && aq < 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS
539 && GMP_NUMB_BITS < bq && bq <= 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
540 return mpfr_sqr_2 (a, b, rnd_mode, aq);
541
542 if (aq == GMP_NUMB_BITS && bq <= GMP_NUMB_BITS)
543 return mpfr_sqr_1n (a, b, rnd_mode);
544
545 if (2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS < aq && aq < 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS
546 && 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS < bq && bq <= 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
547 return mpfr_sqr_3 (a, b, rnd_mode, aq);
548#endif
549
550 ax = 2 * MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
551 MPFR_ASSERTN (2 * (mpfr_uprec_t) bq <= MPFR_PREC_MAX);
552
553 bn = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE (b); /* number of limbs of b */
554 tn = MPFR_PREC2LIMBS (2 * bq); /* number of limbs of square,
555 2*bn or 2*bn-1 */
556
557 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bn > MPFR_SQR_THRESHOLD))
558 return mpfr_mul (a, b, b, rnd_mode);
559
560 MPFR_TMP_MARK(marker);
561 tmp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (2 * bn);
562
563 /* Multiplies the mantissa in temporary allocated space */
564 mpn_sqr (tmp, MPFR_MANT(b), bn);
565 b1 = tmp[2 * bn - 1];
566
567 /* now tmp[0]..tmp[2*bn-1] contains the product of both mantissa,
568 with tmp[2*bn-1]>=2^(GMP_NUMB_BITS-2) */
569 b1 >>= GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1; /* msb from the product */
570
571 /* if the mantissas of b and c are uniformly distributed in ]1/2, 1],
572 then their product is in ]1/4, 1/2] with probability 2*ln(2)-1 ~ 0.386
573 and in [1/2, 1] with probability 2-2*ln(2) ~ 0.614 */
574 tmp += 2 * bn - tn; /* +0 or +1 */
575 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(b1 == 0))
576 mpn_lshift (tmp, tmp, tn, 1); /* tn <= k, so no stack corruption */
577
578 cc = mpfr_round_raw (MPFR_MANT (a), tmp, 2 * bq, 0, aq, rnd_mode, &inexact);
579 /* cc = 1 ==> result is a power of two */
580 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(cc))
581 MPFR_MANT(a)[MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(a)-1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
582
583 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
584 {
585 mpfr_exp_t ax2 = ax + (mpfr_exp_t) (b1 - 1 + cc);
586 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY( ax2 > __gmpfr_emax))
587 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
588 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY( ax2 < __gmpfr_emin))
589 {
590 /* In the rounding to the nearest mode, if the exponent of the exact
591 result (i.e. before rounding, i.e. without taking cc into account)
592 is < __gmpfr_emin - 1 or the exact result is a power of 2 (i.e. if
593 both arguments are powers of 2), then round to zero. */
594 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
595 (ax + (mpfr_exp_t) b1 < __gmpfr_emin || mpfr_powerof2_raw (b)))
596 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
597 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
598 }
599 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, ax2);
600 MPFR_SET_POS (a);
601 }
602 MPFR_RET (inexact);
603}
604
